speed_limits.notes: Speed limits vary significantly by road condition. Follow signs strictly.

alcohol_limit.notes: Zero tolerance (0.00%) for drivers helding a licence for less than 5 years.

rules.seatbelt_rules: Mandatory for driver and all passengers.
rules.child_seat_rules: Children under 6 years or 135cm must use a child restraint system.
rules.phone_usage_rules: Hand-held usage is prohibited. Hands-free is allowed.
rules.headlights_rules: Must be on if visibility is poor.
rules.priority_rules: Yield to vehicles on main roads. Vehicles on the left generally have priority at uncontrolled intersections, but caution is advised.

tolls.notes: Many motorways around Bangkok require cash or 'Easy Pass'.

rules.parking_rules: Do not park on red/white curbs (no parking anytime) or yellow/white curbs (temporary parking).

motorcycle.lane_splitting_rules: Common practice and generally tolerated, but exercise extreme caution.
motorcycle.motorway_access: Prohibited on most expressways and tollways.
motorcycle.licensing_notes: International Driving Permit (IDP) with motorcycle endorsement is strictly required for tourists.

summary: Driving in Thailand can be chaotic. Traffic rules are often loosely observed by locals. Be extremely vigilant for motorbikes weaving in traffic. Left-hand traffic applies.
common_traps: Police checkpoints checking for International Driving Permits (IDP).
rental_and_idp_notes: IDP (1949 Convention) is mandatory. Rental shops may keep your passport as deposit (avoid if possible).
